p: Finally, it should be noted that it would have been ideal to have available longer time series of environmental data than the 2 × 4 years used here. As was shown by Nordam et al. ( 2016), the variations in ensemble results between years can be quite significant. Furthermore, phenomena like the Arctic Oscillation (Rigor et al. 2002) can affect the ice cover on a time scale of one or more years, leading to a possible bias in the results.
